intro: Veronica schmidtiana var. senanensis, commonly known as the Senanense speedwell, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or woodland borders. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
